name: Malicious Link
description: An adversary may rely upon a user clicking a malicious link in order to gain execution. Users may be subjected to social engineering to get them to click on a link that will lead to code execution. This user action will typically be observed as follow-on behavior from [Spearphishing Link](https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1566/002). Clicking on a link may also lead to other execution techniques such as exploitation of a browser or application vulnerability via [Exploitation for Client Execution](https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1203). Links may also lead users to download files that require execution via [Malicious File](https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1204/002).
x_mitre_detection:
Inspect network traffic for indications that a user visited a malicious site, such as links included in phishing campaigns directed at your organization.

Anti-virus can potentially detect malicious documents and files that are downloaded from a link and executed on the user's computer.

mitigates.name: Network Intrusion Prevention
mitigates.description: Use intrusion detection signatures to block traffic at network boundaries.

mitigates.name: User Training
mitigates.description: Train users to be aware of access or manipulation attempts by an adversary to reduce the risk of successful spearphishing, social engineering, and other techniques that involve user interaction.

mitigates.name: Restrict Web-Based Content
mitigates.description: Restrict use of certain websites, block downloads/attachments, block Javascript, restrict browser extensions, etc.

requirements.description: Ensure that email gateway security solutions (systems) are configured to block malicious email attachments delivery
Ensure that email attachments containing extensions such as .exe, .scr, .pif, .cpl, etc. are blocked for delivery
Ensure that users are trained to identify social engineering techniques and spearphishing emails
Ensure that the network intrusion prevention system is configured to scan and remove malicious downloads and attachments
Ensure that the endpoint security solution is configured to open and analyze compressed formats (zip) for concealed malwares and remove them
Ensure that network monitoring tools are configured to inspect network traffic to detect indicators which implies a user visited a malicious site
Ensure that the Anti-malware solution is configured to detect malicious documents and files downloaded/ executed on the user's system
